Author: Conventment
Title: Thread Closed.
Body: We've updated the campaign post with some updated directions. Once someone changes their signature, they post their ETH address and mention they've changed it. They'll be rewarded each day as long as their signature stays.  Quote from: ansi on August 15, 2018, 10:22:38 AM You guys o no that this Cannabis niche / business is restricted in like 99% of the countries worldwide out there. Why taking the risk of investing in something that may be at any moment BANNED by a country that made it " legal " today "?  We totally understand the risks. As mentioned in our white paper, most startups and businesses in the cannabis industry in the US require investors due to banking limitations and regulations. Eventually, what we need is a bank made strictly for the cannabis industry.  Other than that, we believe the complete legalization of cannabis will take place slowly over time. We have no worries at all.

Author: nhatnhatkhongnhi
Title: Thread Closed.
Body: CNVT is a decentralized ERC20 token on the Ethereum network which is backwards compatible with all wallets and hardware that support the ERC20 token standard. CNVT is completely separate from all main Conventment smart contracts and statistic networks. Aside for funding through the TGE, CNVT tokens are solely used for B2B contract bidding by grow centers and manufacturers. These tokens aren't initially utilized in dispensaries or shops but will become a viable form of payment in the future as the DLA Center is improved upon. The total supply of CNVT tokens is limited to 100,000,000.

Body: You're absolutely correct. Suppliers, Manufacturers, Grow Centers, and Shops will all be able to connect to the DLA Center. Author: Conventment
Title: Thread Closed.
Body: Our Bounty Campaign begins tomorrow!  Details coming soon.

Author: Conventment
Title: Thread Closed.
Body: We're not just your typical blockchain-based cannabis business, but we understand where you're coming from. What we're offering is different from what everyone else is offering. We believe our DLA Center and our B2B Contract Bidding feature will prove to be extremely useful to those in the cannabis industry.  Our concept, of course, can easily be applied to other industries, but the cannabis industry is what we'd like to focus on. Streamlining the seed-to-market process isn't an old idea, as you may have mentioned, but our way of doing so with the DLA Center, custom IoT middleware and B2B communication features will prove their worth in due time.

Author: gerald232
Title: Thread Closed.
Body: The platform is building the world's largest IoT-based logistics platform for the legal marijuana industry. Are there plans for project expansion? what about the legality?

Author: Conventment
Title: Thread Closed.
Body: Of course, we have plans for expansion that will be explained in more detail as development continues. After the beta version of our DLA Center is released, we plan on making a few announcements and updating our milestones/roadmap. Our outreach marketing campaign is also due to begin in a few weeks. Things are extremely early right now.  The legality is a tricky issue. As mentioned in our white paper, the need for a TGE is due to banking issues with cannabis-related businesses. Many banks refuse to take part in the cannabis industry. Although cannabis is decriminalized and essentially legal in many states and provinces, there is still a barrier there which will, most likely, go away with time. Banking problems will also hopefully go away with time. Thankfully, we don't provide cannabis ourselves, as we are developing a platform for legal/medical logistics/sales/b2b purposes.  Outside of the US, legality should be much less strict, which is where expansion may have the most potential.

Author: naderba666
Title: Thread Closed.
Body: What is the minimum/maximum amount you can invest in the crowdsale and what will happen to the unsold tokens?

Author: Conventment
Title: Thread Closed.
Body: We currently don't have any limits or minimums put in place.  Unsold tokens from the private sale will be transferred to the public sale, while unsold tokens from the public sale will be split with 60% of tokens going to future bounties and the remaining 40% in a reserve for future development and expenses. Tokens that are put into the Conventment reserve are locked for 24 months from the date that the TGE comes to an end.
